intro: Nonatelia sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flowered nonatelia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to white in color. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and ecological research.
